answers.answer: wow! now I have diabetes myself and I just freaked out when I found out about it and I have had it ever since I was born but it got really bad when they had to take me down to the emergency room and you know it is hard to live with the fact you have diabetes and even my dad has diabetes but ever since well I have been having some amounts of emergency room visits but now I am getting a hang onto things the way they are now.

question: My 23 year old son has been a diabetic, type one since he was nine..He suffers seizures with low bloodsugar.  He had another one this morning....it had been quite a while.  My question is how come the accucheck  reads above 100 when the medics get to the scene.  The ER doc thinks he has seizures, I tend to believe that his liver releases emergency glucose during the seizure to increase his bloodsugar.  How does one know?  He di have an EEG some time ago, which was normal.  He is so afraid that he may be an epileptic.  Any information will be greatly appreciatedSincerely,Ladybugrn58
title: hypoglycemic seizure vs seizure disorder
